title: Virginia Chadwyck-Healey on the art of maternity dressing
text:
You would think I might have mastered the art of maternity dressing by now given that I'm over half way with my third pregnancy. And yet I find myself stumbling over the 'what to wear' conundrum in a big way, each and every morning. You see, I am not hugely keen on buying maternity wear given that it will have a limited shelf life, and that rather goes against exactly what I'm trying to promote through my usual 'Buy Fewer Buy Better' philosophy.

But then, practically speaking, I can't actually find my old pieces from my last pregnancies and I no longer fit my normal jeans. So, to avoid heading to meetings or visiting clients in my tracksuit bottoms, I probably need to embrace the second trimester...
description: You would think I might have mastered the art of maternity dressing by now given that I'm over half way with my third pregnancy.
